headline: Peach Pie the Old Fashioned Two Crust Way
description: Old-fashioned peach pie made with two crusts, fresh peaches, and simple ingredients. This summer pie is delicious served warm with vanilla ice cream.

video.description: Watch how to make this simple peach pie.
video.name: Peach Pie the Old Fashioned Two Crust Way

name: Peach Pie the Old Fashioned Two Crust Way
recipeIngredient: 1 (14.1 ounce) package pastry for a double-crust 9-inch pie

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (220 degrees C).
Line the bottom and sides of a 9-inch pie plate with one pie crust. Lightly brush crust with egg to prevent dough from becoming soggy later. Set second crust aside.

Place peaches in a large bowl, sprinkle with lemon juice, and mix gently. Mix together sugar, flour, cinnamon, nutmeg, and salt in a separate bowl. Pour over peaches and mix until combined. Pour into pie crust and dot with butter.

Cover filling with remaining pie crust. Flute the edges to seal or use a fork dipped in egg to press them down. Brush remaining egg on top, then cut several slits in the top crust to allow steam to escape.

Bake pie in the preheated oven for 10 minutes. Reduce the heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) and bake until crust is brown and juice begins to bubble through the vents, 30 to 35 more minutes. If the edges brown too fast, cover them with strips of aluminum foil about halfway through baking.
Cool pie for 15 minutes before slicing.

review.reviewBody: We made these with a bottom crust and top crust (no crust on the sides), and they were delicious. I used my recipe for the crusts made out of butter. We brushed both top and bottom crusts with butter. We also used extra butter in the filling.
Did everything according to directions, turned out very soggy and the fruit wasn't even cooked all the way

I followed some other suggestions - 1/2 lemon juice 1/2 vanilla / 1/2 sugar and 1/2 brown sugar - my entire house smells like a peach orchard - can’t wait to fully try it- with some vanilla ice cream on top…..
Pre cook the bottom crust for about 10 min instead of egg wash

Fantastic recipe. I omitted the nutmeg as I used the Land O Lakes apple pie crust recipe which has that in it. Used 2T cornstarch instead of the flour and added 1 t. vanilla. Put in a deep dish pie pan. I always put a handful of sugar on the bottom crust before adding the filling because my mom always did that. It took 55 minutes total to bake. My husband took it to work this morning and everyone raved about it. He told me "Write that recipe down". The secret to a great pie crust is to not overwork it. I use real butter cold and grate it into the dry mix, use a fork to incorporate, then add the cold water. This always turns out flaky and light. It definitely beats store bought!
This is the best peach pie recipe I’ve ever had! My family also approves.
Made the recipe exactly, and was delicious. My husband is picking, and he really likes it. Thank you
I used a 10” pie plate & increased the peaches to 6 cups.
Great recipe, it's in the oven now and I'm sure that it will be a hit!
This recipe is terrific!! Easy to follow, simple, and it turned out perfectly! I always wondered how to keep the inside of bottom crust from going soggy. Yummmmm!!!!!
Recipe was great and easy
This recipe was easy. The pie was a bit runny but was just delicious with both whipped cream or vanilla ice cream
I think it turned out wonderful! The only thing I noticed is that it took longer to bake this pie, than the recipe instructs, worth it though. I hope you like the finished product photo.

I used fresh August Prince peaches. Next time I'm going to add a tad bit of corn starch. I'm assuming the fresh peaches cooked out more juice than canned and I don't want to add an off taste by increasing the flour. As for the lemon juice, necessary, but 2 tablespoons adds too much tang. Next time I'm going to cut it in half and see how it tastes. Definitely going to do this again!
Good recipe. I added some brown sugar to add a little caramel flavor!
We loved this recipe! Per some of the recommendations, we tossed the peaches in lemon juice in a colander and it wasn’t too tart at all!
This recipe was SO easy. I did use prepared refrigerated pie crust but it was amazing!! It was delicious and looked gorgeous! The only addition was Turbinato sugar on top to give it some crunch.
It was the most absolutely delicious peach pie soup I've ever had in my life! I'm going to try cornstarch instead of flour next time. If it turns out, I will let you know
My husband loves peach pie, but after following this recipe he commented that it was the best I had ever made! Grand kudos to this great recipe!!
So good and followed the recipe
This recipe turned out great and is absolutely delicious! The store- bought pie crusts were perfect and not soggy.

I like the lemon juice in the recipe. I used a little less flour, about a third of a cup instead of a half and then a little less nutmeg just because I'm not a huge fan of nutmeg. Everyone who tried it. The pie was great!
I was looking for a peach pie recipe & ran across this one! I'm so happy I did & so is my husband! Thank you for this wonderful recipe, this will be my go peach pie recipe, forever!
Yes, I had no nutmeg, so I used some 5 spice for the combined spices. Don’t know if I’ve ruined my pie because it’s still in the oven - I’ll let you know when it’s done!
This was just like grandma used to make... yummy and easy
My peaches were fresh/frozen from last summer. They were very juicy, so drained them for abt 30 minutes. I was out of lemons so I used lime juice; it was delicious!! My husband raved! So good!
I didn't use any sugar, because I used my fresh frozen peaches that I froze with sugar.
Done & Done
The recipe was very easy. I made mine with peaches and strawberries.
I followed this recipe to the letter. This is my first ever pie and it was perfect! I used white peaches.

The best peach pie ever! I used 1 1/2 cups Splenda instead of sugar and added 1 tbs vanilla extract after squeezing the juice of 2 lemons on the peach slices. Not tart at all, but succulent and very tasty. Will definitely do this one again. Served it warm with 2 scoops vanilla ice cream. Yummy!!!

Very good. I try to always do the recipe as directed the first time out. I added slightly more peaches only because my peaches are white peaches and are juicier and shrink a little more. I went with this recipe because it reminded me of a basic apple pie recipe. Perfect, no changes necessary. I plan on making two more pies tomorrow!

This is the best peach pie recipe ever! I put a lattice top crust and sprinkled a dash of sugar on top fresh out of the oven. Also my peaches were really fresh and sweet so I put a little less sugar in the filling mix. 5 stars all the way baby. You won't want to share it.

I made this recipie with fresh Maine peaches off the tree. I used 6 cups peaches. I added 1/2 cup flour more. Plus 1/4tsp cinnamon and nutmeg more. I did 1/4 cup sugar more. These peaches are juicy. I cooked as directed 10 mins @450 then 35 @350. The pie was not baking correctly. I increased the heat to 375 for 25 mins. If your peaches are thickening cook it at a higher temperature. You want those beautiful bubbles from the peaches.. The pie thickened beautifully with more heat. I added sugar to the egg wash for the top crust.

The flavor was decent, but the filling was runny even after 6 hours of cooling, and I got the dreaded soggy bottom, even using the colander method noted by other reviewers. I will not be doing this recipe again.

My 8 year old granddaughter requested a peach pie. I have never made a peach pie before so I pulled up this recipe. I made it exactly as written. I do have a newer oven that seems to underbake/cook so I increased the bake time an extra 10 minutes and am still worried it was a little under baked. I took it to her while still warm. I’m hoping she likes it. I’ll update after it’s been cut into and eaten.

This pie is delicious and worth every calorie. I followed the recipe with a few minor adjustments. I cut the sugar in half. I didn’t have flour so I used corn starch as a substitute. I dusted the bottom crust with corn starch, this helps it from becoming soggy. I brushed the top crust with egg white, and sprinkled a generous amount of sugar on top. I love the nutmeg, I feel it enhances the flavor of the peaches.
Loved the recipe...Didn't change a thing and getting ready to make another.
My 8 year old son and I followed your recipe to a T! We made ours with fresh peaches from a local farm and it’s by far the best pie I’ve ever had! Thank you!
Awesome recipe. We loved it! Very easy to make and quick. It's a keeper.
I made my own crust, but it was easy and tastes great with our own peaches from our backyard.
I made this according to the recipe except that I made my own crust. The lemony taste was overpowering. Even though I used 5 cups of sliced peaches, the pie has too much sauce and was runny.

Made the recipe exactly as written and it turned out perfectly! I also used the top of staining the peaches after tossing them in the lemon juice to remove any extra liquid, and I used store bought pie crust to save time.
Yummy! The uglier the baked good I make the better it tastes! I added some hazelnut cream! Delicious!
Baked it a little longer than called for. The crust was perfect, but the filling was a bit underdone.

I made this with fully ripened Georgia peaches Best peach pie I ever made. Even my son, who doesn't like peaches, liked THIS. 

I did make 2 substitutions - replaced sugar with a sucralose/erythritol blend that I use, and I didn't have lemon juice so I added 1/4 tsp Vitamin C powder for tartness. SO GOOD.

Made this for my girlfriend’s family the first time I met them, and it made a great first impression! Didn’t alter the ingredients at all, save for making a crust as opposed to using a premade one (always the move if you’ve got time!), but did leave it in the oven after turning the oven off. Came out perfectly and was delicious with a scoop of vanilla ice cream, and I’m not even a peach fan.
Ran out of flour and used cornstarch instead. Was still amazing. Used remade tolled out crust. Very easy recipe. Made with star cutouts for the 4th of July.
That pie is delicious! I do admit that “dot with butter” meant very big dots to me! Making it again this weekend.
Perfect recipe! I only used 3/4 cup sugar, but ended up baking close to an hour and it sliced perfectly because I let it set for about 30 minutes. My new go to recipe
Made this for my husbands birthday. Didn't have lemon juice so I substituted oj and it was fine. Would absolutely make this again and again.
Does this work with frozen peaches.
So easy and so good! Definitely had the old-fashioned feel to it. Will make this pie every August from now on!
Turns out perfectly every time, I have no idea what the problem with the lemon juice was. A real hit at thanksgiving!

This is a FANTASTIC recipe!!!! I made this pie at the spur of a moment and only had a very large can of peaches in sweetened juice. I made my own 2 crust recipe but since I didn’t have the amount of peaches the recipe called for (I just used an 8” pie pan), I cut the ingredients in half. I didn’t use the egg but instead baked it on my quarry tiles I keep in my oven. It was DELISH and got RAVE REVIEWS from the recipients!!! Thank you for this recipe!!!! You made me look GOOD!!!
No changes. Just like my mothers back in the 60s.
It seemed like too much flour and the pie didn't bake properly even after adding extra time. Tasted fine but had a strange texture.
Wow! Sooooo good!! I love the simplicity of this pie… The recipe for the filling was spot on and I look forward to making it again very soon. Thank you for sharing.

I used frozen peaches that I had thawed out. I should have cooked them down before putting in pie. I had to put pie back in oven another 30 minutes after checking it when it should have been done. Or just use fresh peaches.
This pie was great. I did make my own crust and took the advice of one of the reviewers and added the lemon juice while in the colander. I will most definitely be making this pie again.
Bake time is way too short, after the full 10 + 35, it was still super runny. Also, too much sugar.
I try to never change a recipe. followed this to a t. It was wonderful. Exactly what I was looking for. You can't go wrong with this recipe.

Absolutely delicious! I did half brown sugar and half white sugar. Everyone gobbled it up right away. Not overwhelmingly sweet just right amount of sweet with the 5 small white peaches I used. My favorite pie!
Love the recipe but cut back on the sugar by half!!
My husband loved it. Crust was a bit soggy, maybe I didn’t use enough egg.

I loved this recipe! I used the recipe exactly and it was one of the best pies I ever made! I will use this recipe again!
I used Pillsbury ready-made crusts.

Really good, straightforward peach pie recipe--which I very much appreciate. There's something to be said about a peach pie recipe when it lets the fresh flavor of late summer peaches really shine through; and this recipe nailed it. It was delicious, and so 'peachy'. I did lessen the lemon juice to 1 tbsp, and used 3/4 cup sugar as my peaches were very ripe. Very nice recipe, thank you for sharing it.

This was my first try at ANY pie. We went peach picking today and needed something different to do with all of our peaches. I followed the directions 100%. I could have left it in a bit longer, and now that I read the comments I will lessen the lemon and nutmeg next time. Also I did not brush the bottom crust with egg, I just poked it with a fork a few times, it baked beautifully. I will definitely be making again, just with a few tweaks!

Recipe works well. Had to substitute a teaspoon of all spice for the cinnamon/nutmeg since I was out of cinnamon. Seems to have worked out. 

Timing was way off for me but I used a glass pie baking tray and the pie was quite large. Ended up cooking for about 1h 20m total and could have prob used a bit more time. Dough on the bottom wasn’t cooked through. 

I would prob cook it for 1h 35m next time.

Love this recipe. I have made it no less than a dozen times, always to rave reviews. Like most cooks I tweak a recipe to suit my taste. I really did not see a need to change this one. I always use fresh peaches or peaches I have peeled and frozen. I use either a rolled prepared crust or homemade. Homemade is definitely better if you have the time. I also drain the peaches (definitely the frozen ones).
It turned out wonderful! I didn't have a lemon so used a bit of lime juice. The taste was sweet and the texture creamy. And the Lattice crust looked beautiful. I will make this again and again!
Made this pie for the first time, but certainly not the last! Just a couple of changes taking the advice of others: used a little over a 1/2 cup of sugar & only 1 tbsp of lemon juice.

Used my home grown Peaches. The pie was easy to make. I added 1 table spoon corn starch to three tablespoons of flour seasoned it with brown sugar and a splash of cinnamon and sprinkle on peaches so the juice would be thick. Easy to make

Followed faithfully and got a delicious pie. I followed other posters’ suggestion to drain peaches b4 putting in the pie shell. Spouse really liked the nutmeg but I thought it overpowered the peaches. Now that I know what the end result is by following the recipe AS WRITTEN*, i think I might try using 1/8 rather than 1/4 tsp nutmeg. Another note I’m filing in my brain is to use hard peaches as ripe ones give out too much juice despite draining. I was pleased with this recipe.

I admit I'm not a baker. I love to cook but baking desserts is not my forte. I made this for a dinner I was invited to. If it didn't turn out right I was going to stop at a local bakery on the way. I didn't have to stop. It turned out way better than expected. Rave reviews. I made exactly as written. Bam. I think I'm a peach pie expert now. LOL.
I just made this and it was so good! The lemon is what gave it the tangy flavor I expect in a peach pie. Fabulous recipe! I will be making this again!

Forgot to brush egg on bottom portion of the crust. 

Forgot to place butter in pie.

Waiting for it to cool down.
My sons loves it. This is the second time I used this recipe. This is the best one for peach pie I have made. I will be making it often. Always with white peaches.

A spectacular recipe! Timesaver note: to easily peel peaches, set a large pot of water to boil, whilst still boiling add the peaches for 30 seconds. Remove asap, let cool a moment, violá! easily peel with your fingers.

I love spices, so doubled the amount of cinnamon & fresh grated nutmeg. Added 
 a tsp. of cardamom to the egg wash. Also added a cup of fresh blueberries to the peaches 'cause I was a half cup short of peaches. Yummy combo!

This is my go-to recipe for peach pie! Only made a few adjustments. Because hubby is diabetic, I used 1/2 cup brown sugar instead of a full cup. Pie still turned out perfect. After squeezing fresh lemon juice over the sliced peaches, I zested some of the peel. This added a welcomed tartness. Also added 1/2 teaspoon almond extract. Made my own crust too. This recipe is good as is.
This is the best peach pie I’ve ever had. The ease of the receipt gets 5 stars. I have made it three times already this season

My family loved this pie! I used a combination of fresh peaches from our backyard peach tree and canned peaches. This recipe is easy to follow and if you use quality ingredients, your pie will turn out delicious. I served it with vanilla ice cream.

My peaches were very juicy. I poured some of the juice off, and carried on with the recipe. The peach mixture was very watery. I knew this was going to be a problem. I cooked it anyway. It was very soupy. Next time, I will use at least 3/4 cup flour, to make sure my peach filling is not watery. The pie slices wouldn't hold shape. Taste was a bit too sweet for me. Maybe use less sugar, or combine brown sugar and white sugar might yield a better pie, for me. But, Thank you!

This is an awesome recipe and easy to make sugar-free with Splenda or Stevia .
Today I made a peach/raspberry and a peach/blueberry pie. 
 I do use the lemon juice to help keep the peaches fresher, but I also choose the ripest peaches I can find for their inherent sweetness.
Home-made crust is always best but I have Marie Callendar pie crusts in the freezer and a box of Pillsbury in the refrigerator for in a pinch. They all work with this recipe.
Great as is. If I change the recipe, I feel I am not reviewing it. So if I change it, I don't send In a review.

We made a few changes. We added a less lemon juice and instead of nutmeg used ginger. The recipe was really good. The only thing that was hard was peeling the peaches. And we made a lattice crust. I give it 5 stars. -Barrett, 10 yrs

Great peach pie recipe. I took some of the recommendations from the other bakers. The only changes that I made were that I only used 1 tbsp lemon juice (instead of 2) so it wouldn’t be too runny and I used 3/4 cup white sugar mixed with 1/4 cup light brown sugar. I used fresh peaches that were not over ripe and they held up perfectly. Also, I did bake it about 10 minutes longer than suggested. It was delicious!
amazing I personally doubled the nutmeg and would 100% recommend anyone else doing so
The cinnamon and nutmeg is a bit overpowering so the filling becomes bitter. The lemon makes it a bit too tangy. Next time I would probably leave out the lemon or add a bit more sugar.
I used 3/4 c white sugar and 1/4 c brown to add more depth. So fabulous!
A very good recipe but I don't understand why it's very watery I followed all the instructions as recipe said.
A very good recipe but I don't understand why it's very watery I followed all the instructions as recipe said.
I followed the recipe exactly. Not what I expected. If I were to make this pie again, I would use half of the nutmeg and cinnamon. I wasn't crazy about the overpowering flavor of the spices.

i made one with a top crust and one without a top crust. they were gone the first night. i have been requested to make 3 more for family and friends. awesome, "the Bomb" the best and YUMMMM were mostly the responses. i can only hope my peach trees can keep up with the demand. truly excellent pie.
My husband loved it
Easy recipe! Haven’t tasted it yet. Will update!!
Easy to follow and tastes great!!!

Never made or eaten a peach pie before. A friend gave me a bag from his tree and I didn’t want to waste them. An amazing recipe! Have made six pies so far....and have frozen enough peaches for another six. Loved the pies!
I had made the recipe 3 times and it was great. The 4 th time it was runny. I finally realized that I had used whole wheat flour the first 3 times. It made all the difference.

item.name: Peach Pie the Old Fashioned Two Crust Way
